required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Cross-Over Study of Self-Insertion of Two Placebo Vaginal Film Formulations
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Double-Blind Cross-Over Study of Self-Insertion of Two Formulations of a Placebo Vaginal Film

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a double-blinded crossover study to evaluate whether Eudragit® content impacts the ability to self-insert placebo vaginal films. Thirty women will self-insert one high and and one low Eudragit® content film. The insertion order will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio. After inserting each film, participants will complete a survey reporting their perceptions and experience. The primary endpoint is successful insertion defined as all of the film inside the vagina upon visual assessment by a study clinician. Secondary outcomes include preference for the low level or high level Eudragit® formulation film with respect to insertion and participants' description of identified challenges.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a double-blinded crossover study to evaluate whether ammonio methacrylate copolymer dispersion type B (Eudragit®) content impacts the ability to self-insert placebo vaginal films. Eudragit® is a commonly used pharmaceutical excipient, present in several FDA approved products. This hydrophobic excipient is used in vaginal film formulations to increase disintegration time and impart extended drug release property. The presence of Eudragit and its concentration level affects film disintegration and spreadability in the vaginal environment, and are likely to affect tactile properties. Consequently, these attributes may impact ease of film administration, acceptability, and user preferences for specific film type.
Thirty pre-menopausal women, 18 - 45 years of age, will self-insert one high and and one low Eudragit® content film. High and low Eudragit films correspond to 12.8% and 6.4% of Eudragit® added during the formulation blending stage. The insertion order will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio. Within 10 minutes of the insertion, clinical staff will perform a speculum exam to assess the location of the film and remove the residual film. After inserting each film, participants will complete a survey reporting their perceptions and experience. The primary endpoint is successful insertion defined as all of the film inside the vagina upon visual assessment by a study clinician. Secondary outcomes include preference for the low level or high level Eudragit® formulation film with respect to insertion and participants' description of identified challenges.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Each participant will self-insert one low level Eudragit® and one high level Eudragit® formulation film. The sequence of insertion will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio.
study_design_info.masking_description: The participants, clinicians, and assessors of the study outcomes will be blinded to Eudragit® content of the film.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Successfully Insert Vaginal Film
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants that successfully insert each vaginal film defined as the film location being completely inside the vagina upon visual assessment by a clinician

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Report Self-Insertion of Vaginal Film was Easy
secondary_outcome.description: Participants that report that self-insertion of the placebo vaginal film was very easy or easy as assessed on a Likert scale from 1 (very easy) to 5 (very difficult)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants that Prefer the High over the Low Eudragit® Content Vaginal Film
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants that report that they would prefer to use the high Eudragit® content vaginal film over the low Eudragit® content vaginal film

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Eudragit® Film, then Low Eudragit® Film
arm_group.description: High (12.8%) Eudragit® content vaginal film, then low (6.4%) Eudragit® content vaginal film

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low Eudragit® Film, then High Eudragit® Film
arm_group.description: Low (6.4%) Eudragit® content vaginal film, then high (12.8%) Eudragit® content vaginal film

intervention.arm_group_label: High Eudragit® Film, then Low Eudragit® Film
Low Eudragit® Film, then High Eudragit® Film
High Eudragit® Film, then Low Eudragit® Film
Low Eudragit® Film, then High Eudragit® Film

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 18-45
- Intact uterus by participant report
- Agrees to abstain from inserting anything into the vagina for 24 hours prior to the study visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Menopausal (as defined as amenorrhea for one year or more without an alternative etiology)
- Hysterectomy (including total and supracervical)
- Currently pregnant or pregnancy within 90 days of enrollment
- Lactating
- Symptoms of a urogenital infection including vaginal discharge, pain, odor, or itching
- Menses at the time of enrollment
- Known allergy or hypersensitivity to any of the components of the placebo film
- Any condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, would preclude provision of consent, make participation in the study unsafe, complicate interpretation of study outcome data, or otherwise interfere with achieving the study objectives.

facility.name: University of Pittsburgh, Magee Womens Hospital

link.description: UNAIDS Women and Girls and HIV.
